$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Minimize} && \sum_{t=1}^T \sum_{p=1}^P \left( \text{BaseCost}_t \cdot x_{t,p} + \text{PerMWCost}_t \cdot y_{t,p} + \text{StartupCost}_t \cdot z_{t,p} \right) \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{t=1}^T y_{t,p} \geq D_p \quad \forall p \in \mathcal{P} \\
& && y_{t,p} \geq \text{MinOutput}_t \cdot x_{t,p} \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T}, p \in \mathcal{P} \\
& && y_{t,p} \leq \text{MaxOutput}_t \cdot x_{t,p} \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T}, p \in \mathcal{P} \\
& && \sum_{t=1}^T \text{MaxOutput}_t \cdot x_{t,p} \geq 1.15 \cdot D_p \quad \forall p \in \mathcal{P} \\
& && x_{t,p} \leq G_t \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T}, p \in \mathcal{P} \\
& && x_{t,1} \leq S_t + z_{t,1} \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T} \\
& && x_{t,p} \leq x_{t,p-1} + z_{t,p} \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T}, p \in \mathcal{P}, p > 1 \\
& && x_{t,p} \in \mathbb{Z}_+, y_{t,p} \in \mathbb{R}_+, z_{t,p} \in \mathbb{Z}_+ \quad \forall t \in \mathcal{T}, p \in \mathcal{P}
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example: A power utility company needs to decide which power generation units to turn on and how much power to produce from each unit over a 5-hour period to meet the expected electricity demand. Each unit has a minimum and maximum power output, a base operating cost, a cost per megawatt-hour, and a startup cost. The company must also ensure that the selected units can handle a 15% increase in demand as a reserve requirement. The goal is to minimize the total cost of power generation while satisfying all constraints.
